info.title: Communication Management API
info.description:
**TMF API Reference : TMF 681 - Communication Management**
**Release : 19.5 - March 2020**
This API provides a standardized mechanism for Communication management such as creation, update, retrieval, deletion and notification of the system communication events.
This API manages the following data resources:
- Communication Message

get.description: This operation list or find CommunicationMessage entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

post.description: This operation creates a CommunicationMessage entity.

get.description: This operation retrieves a CommunicationMessage entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

patch.description: This operation updates partially a CommunicationMessage entity.

delete.description: This operation deletes a CommunicationMessage entity.

post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

post.description: Example of a client listener for receiving the notification CommunicationMessageAttributeValueChangeEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification CommunicationMessageStateChangeEvent

Attachment.description: Complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures...

id.description: Unique identifier for this particular attachment

attachmentType.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

content.description: The actual contents of the attachment object, if embedded, encoded as base64

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

mimeType.description: Attachment mime type such as extension file for video, picture and document

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

validFor.description: The period of time for which the attachment is valid

Characteristic.description: Describes a given characteristic of an object or entity through a name/value pair.

valueType.description: Data type of the value of the characteristic

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

CharacteristicRelationship.description: Another Characteristic that is related to the current Characteristic;

CommunicationMessage.description: Communication message means a notification approach in the format of a message which can be dispatched (sent) to the certain user by the system with the content which can be felt and understood by the recipient. The user can be either a final customer or a customer service agent. The message can reach the customer in different interaction channels, including: email, short message, mobile app notification (push).

href.description: Hypertext Reference of the Communication Message

content.description: The content of the communication message

messageType.description: The type of message, such as: SMS, Email, Mobile app push notification

priority.description:
The priority of the communication message.
Small number means higher priority.

scheduledSendTime.description: The scheduled time for sending the communication message

sendTime.description: The time of sending communication message

sendTimeComplete.description: The time of completion of sending communication message

subject.description: The title of the message, necessary for the email and mobile app push

tryTimes.description: How many times do you want to retry the delivery of this message?

attachment.description: Any attachment associated with this message

characteristic.description: Any additional characteristic(s) of this message

EntityRef.description: Entity reference schema to be use for all entityRef class.

Quantity.description: An amount in a given unit

amount.description: Numeric value in a given unit

appUserId.description: ID of the mobile app user

email.description: Receiver address of email, if the communication type is email

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of the receiver, if the communication type is SMS.

RelatedParty.description: Related Entity reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

role.description: Role played by the related party

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

email.description: Sender address of email, if the communication type is email

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of the sender, if the communication type is SMS.

TimePeriod.description: A period of time, either as a deadline (endDateTime only) a startDateTime only, or both

endDateTime.description: End of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

startDateTime.description: Start of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

EventSubscription.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver notification information

EventSubscriptionInput.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver notification information

correlationId.description: The correlation id for this event.

fieldPath.description: The path identifying the object field concerned by this notification.

event.description: The event payload linked to the involved resource object

communicationMessage.description: The involved resource data for the event

event.description: The event payload linked to the involved resource object

correlationId.description: The correlation id for this event.

communicationMessage.description: The involved resource data for the event

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)

code.description: Application relevant detail, defined in the API or a common list.

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class.
